result.execSummary:
The defendant Kathleen Ann Neumann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(from) Attorney Hartley reflecting Restitution in the amount of TWO HUNDRED DOLLARS ($200.00) to HOME DEPOT has been paid.  The new amount of Restiution owed is FIVE HUNDRED AND THIRTY DOLLARS ($530.00).  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Kathleen Ann Neumann in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

VETERAN COURT

Based upon the defendant's compliance with Veterans Treatment Initiative Court, court finds the agreement is fulfilled.  Defendant is awarded with a Certificate and a Medallion of completion of Veterans Treatment Initiative.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve FIVE (5) DAYS in the House of Correction with FIVE (5) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.  CONCURRENT TO COUNT(S) 2, 3.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant sentenced to serve FIVE (5) DAYS in the House of Correction with FIVE (5) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  CONCURRENT TO COUNT(S) 1, 3.

AS TO COUNT 3:

Defendant sentenced to serve FIVE (5) DAYS in the House of Correction with FIVE (5) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  CONCURRENT TO COUNT(S) 1, 2.

* Restitution payable to HOME DEPOT (11071 W. NATIONAL AVE) for SEVEN HUNDRED AND THIRTY DOLLARS ($730.00) CONVERTED FORTHWITH to civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.

COURT WAIVED ALL COSTS, FEES AND SUCHARGES IN THE INTERESTS OF THE COMMUNITY.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Kathleen Ann Neumann in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg

  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pre-trial Report. Filed, sdg.

Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 10-06-15 at 8:30 in branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-06-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kathleen Ann Neumann in court with attorney Paul Manley on behalf of Christopher Lee Hartley.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. NO FILE IN COURT. Discussions of Justice Point violation report placed on the record. Court admonished the defendant. If another violation, court will order high cash bail. Case remains set for Status Conference on 8/13/2015 at 8:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report; Positive Test.

Defendant Kathleen Ann Neumann in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kathleen Ann Neumann in court PRO SE.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant requests time to hire counsel. Court granted request and provided defendant with information. Case adjourned to branch 47 for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Home Depot- All Stores In Milwaukee County

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kathleen Ann Neumann in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Kathleen Ann Neumann in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty as to all counts.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
